column2: QIAquick PCR Purification Kit - Spin Protocol
PCR sample(s)
Purified DNA

This protocol is designed to purify single- or double-stranded DNA fragments from PCR and other enzymatic reactions (see page 8). For cleanup of other enzymatic reactions, follow the protocol as described for PCR samples or use the MinElute Reaction Cleanup Kit. Fragments ranging from 100 bp to 10 kb are purified from primers, nucleotides, polymerases, and salts using QIAquick spin columns in a microcentrifuge.
QIAquick® Spin Handbook, March 2008
DNA Purification
Qiagen, QIAquick PCR Purification Kit, Spin protocol
Step Text
Add ethanol (96–100%) to Buffer PE before use (see bottle label for volume)

Add 1:250 volume pH indicator I to Buffer PB (i.e., add 120 _l pH indicator I to30 ml Buffer PB or add 600 _l pH indicator I to 150 ml Buffer PB). The yellow colorof Buffer PB with pH indicator I indicates a pH of ≤ 7.5.

column5: pH Indicator I,  (Qiagen's QIAquick PCR Purification Kit)

Add pH indicator I to entire buffer contents. Do not add pH indicator I to buffer aliquots. If the purified PCR product is to be used in sensitive microarray applications, it may be beneficial to use Buffer PB without the addition of pH indicator I.

column2: Add 5 volumes of Buffer PB to 1 volume of the PCR sample and mix.

column5: Buffer, PB (Qiagen's QIAquick PCR Purification Kit)
It is not necessary to remove mineral oil or kerosene.
by pipetting up and down (Curator assumed)

column2: If pH indicator I has beein added to Buffer PB, check that the color of the mixture is yellow. If the color of the mixture is orange or violet, add 10 _l of 3 M sodium acetate, pH 5.0, and mix. The color of the mixture will turn to yellow.
column5: color of Buffer PB with pH Indicator I
If the color of the mixture is orange or violet, add 10 _l of 3 M sodium acetate, pH 5.0, and mix. The color of the mixture will turn to yellow.
by pipetting up and down (Curator assumed)
Optional: If pH indicator I has been added to Buffer PB

column2: Place a QIAquick spin column in a provided 2 ml collection tube.
To bind DNA, apply the sample to the QIAquick column and centrifuge for 30–60 s.
Discard flow-through. Place the QIAquick column back into the same tube.Collection tubes are re-used to reduce plastic waste.

column5: Collection tubes are re-used to reduce plastic waste.

column2: To wash, add 0.75 ml Buffer PE to the QIAquick column and centrifuge for 30–60 s.

column5: Buffer, PE (Qiagen's QIAquick PCR Purification Kit)

column2: Discard flow-through and place the QIAquick column back in the same tube.Centrifuge the column for an additional 1 min.IMPORTANT: Residual ethanol from Buffer PE will not be completely removed unlessthe flow-through is discarded before this additional centrifugation.

column5: IMPORTANT: Residual ethanol from Buffer PE will not be completely removed unlessthe flow-through is discarded before this additional centrifugation.

column2: Place QIAquick column in a clean 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube.
To elute DNA, add 50 _l Buffer EB (10 mM Tris·Cl, pH 8.5) tothe center of the QIAquick membrane and centrifuge the column for 1 min.

column5: IMPORTANT: Ensure that the elution buffer is dispensed directly onto the QIAquick membrane for complete elution of bound DNA. The average eluate volume is 48 _l from 50 _l elution buffer volume. Elution efficiency is dependent on pH. The maximum elution efficiency is achieved between pH 7.0 and 8.5. The purified DNA can also be eluted in TE buffer (10 mM Tris·Cl, 1 mM EDTA, pH 8.0), but the EDTA may inhibit subsequent enzymatic reactions.

column2: To elute DNA, add 50 _l water (pH 7.0–8.5) to the center of the QIAquick membrane and centrifuge the column for 1 min.

column5: IMPORTANT: Ensure that the water is dispensed directly onto the QIAquick membrane for complete elution of bound DNA. The average eluate volume is 48 _l from 50 _l water volume. Elution efficiency is dependent on pH. The maximum elution efficiency is achieved between pH 7.0 and 8.5. When using water, make sure that the pH value is within this range, and store DNA at –20°C as DNA may degrade in the absence of a buffering agent. The purified DNA can also be eluted in TE buffer (10 mM Tris·Cl, 1 mM EDTA, pH 8.0), but the EDTA may inhibit subsequent enzymatic reactions.

column2: To elute DNA, add 30 _l elution buffer to the center of the QIAquick membrane, let the column stand for 1 min, and then centrifuge.

column5: IMPORTANT: Ensure that the elution buffer is dispensed directly onto the QIAquick membrane for complete elution of bound DNA. The average eluate volume is 28 _l from 30 _l elution buffer. Elution efficiency is dependent on pH. The maximum elution efficiency is achieved between pH 7.0 and 8.5. The purified DNA can also be eluted in TE buffer (10 mM Tris·Cl, 1 mM EDTA, pH 8.0), but the EDTA may inhibit subsequent enzymatic reactions.

column2: If the purified DNA is to be analyzed on a gel, add 1 volume of Loading Dye to5 volumes of purified DNA. Mix the solution by pipetting up and down beforeloading the gel.

column5: Optional: This step to be done if loading the DNA onto a gel. Loading dye contains 3 marker dyes (bromophenol blue, xylene cyanol, and orange G) that facilitate estimation of DNA migration distance and optimization of agarose gel run time. Refer to Table 2 (page 15) to identify the dyes according to migration distance and agarose gel percentage and type.
